{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3549538,"name":"","username":"baysal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baysal/{size}/264934_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T18:12:41.195Z","cooked":"

We have just finished our first regional (Istanbul Regional) in the Reefscape season, and saw teams that have pushed the limits of climbing and climbing speed and efficiency.

We‚Äôre curious what‚Äôs the best climb you‚Äôve seen so far? If you could answer these questions we would greatly appreciate it.

The fastest climb you‚Äôve witnessed
The most consistent and reliable climb
A climb that stood out for its simplicity or efficiency

If you have a video or match clip, even better! We would like to learn and highlight some of the most effective climbing solutions this season.

Drop your favorites below!

The 3847 / 4414 style climbs have been sick to watch

190 still has my heart by far

33‚Äôs climb scares me everytime

These are all the teams that contribute 9 or more Endgame Points according to Statbotics:

num team endgame_points
111 WildStang 10.7
5951 Makers Assemble 10.4
3128 The Aluminum Narwhals 10.3
7457 suPURDUEper Robotics 10.3
2930 Sonic Squirrels 10.2
5199 Robot Dolphins From Outer S‚Ä¶ 9.9
581 Blazing Bulldogs 9.8
972 Iron Claw 9.8
2539 Krypton Cougars 9.7
3656 Dexter Dreadbots 9.6
6328 Mechanical Advantage 9.5
8608 Alpha Bots 9.5
4513 Circuit Breakers 9.5
9609 Paraducks 9.4
7539 Elev8 9.3
1731 Fresta Valley Robotics Club 9.3
8422 Husky Howlers 9.3
33 Killer Bees 9.1
5614 Team Sycamore 9
9450 Velocity Raptors 9

Do these climbs have anything in common?

111 has the most consistent climb right now by a not-insignificant margin, and they‚Äôve posted a lot about their climb in their build blog.

4513 is 14 for 15 for deep climbs. Had a weird thing happen that we had never seen in other matches or testing, and it resulted in no successful climb in one match. Even nailed one where our alliance member playing defense smashed through our cage in end game and wrecked one of our polycarb guards (we were maybe 2 feet from the cage at that point). Been working pretty well, easy rp

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T19:06:22.289Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":580,"readers_count":579,"score":131.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494508,"topic_slug":"the-best-most-optimal-and-fastest-climbs-what-have-you-seen","display_username":"Corbin Kuster","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63322,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/the-best-most-optimal-and-fastest-climbs-what-have-you-seen/494508/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3549627,"name":"John Christiansen","username":"XaulZan11","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xaulzan11/{size}/2313_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T19:14:28.919Z","cooked":"
John_Bottenberg:

111 has the most consistent climb right now by a not-insignificant margin, and they‚Äôve posted a lot about their climb in their build blog .

I think 111‚Äôs number is here inflated by the fact that they picked two teams that could not climb. So, for 5 of their 14 matches they could not be hurt by their partners missing a climb.

Looking at percentage of matches where a team deep climbed would probably be more accurate without watching every match and calculating success rate.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T19:14:28.919Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":538,"readers_count":537,"score":167.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494508,"topic_slug":"the-best-most-optimal-and-fastest-climbs-what-have-you-seen","display_username":"John Christiansen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7040,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1706 - Scouting & Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/the-best-most-optimal-and-fastest-climbs-what-have-you-seen/494508/7","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3549631,"name":"John Bottenberg","username":"John_Bottenberg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john_bottenberg/{size}/224569_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T19:17:24.171Z","cooked":"
XaulZan11:

Looking at percentage of matches where a team deep climbed would probably be more accurate without watching every match and calculating success rate.

In order to do that I would have to write Python code, which I normally can only be bothered to do as part of an employment relationship where I am getting duly compensated.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T19:17:36.501Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":497,"readers_count":496,"score":189.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494508,"topic_slug":"the-best-most-optimal-and-fastest-climbs-what-have-you-seen","display_username":"John Bottenberg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12266,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3142, 8706, 714‚Üê4973‚Üê2930‚Üê3322‚Üê67"},"post_url":"/t/the-best-most-optimal-and-fastest-climbs-what-have-you-seen/494508/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3549638,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T19:19:18.689Z","cooked":"

I think that might be the case, however statbotics does take into account teams‚Äô average climb points, so it would only matter if teams‚Äô climb rate changed from quals to elims. (Which could very well be the case, it‚Äôs hard to climb with added pressure)

111 successfully climbed in 14/16 matches we played at NLR. (One due to not latching in 58?3 and one due to pulling too far, which we later fixed.)
I‚Äôm fairly sure we successfully climbed in all ~8 practice matches.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T19:19:18.689Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":484,"readers_count":483,"score":111.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494508,"topic_slug":"the-best-most-optimal-and-fastest-climbs-what-have-you-seen","display_username":"Eliot Dunn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7040,"username":"XaulZan11","name":"John Christiansen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xaulzan11/{size}/2313_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52966,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"111 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/the-best-most-optimal-and-fastest-climbs-what-have-you-seen/494508/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3549645,"name":"E L","username":"e172","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/e172/{size}/256379_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T19:20:46.786Z","cooked":"

1684s (released yesterday iirc) looks WILD and i cant wait to see it in person at Kettering 2 this weekend.

really any teams with a donut climb have captured my heart this season, but in terms of fastest climb it probably has to be 190. 494/70 also have extremely fast deep climbs with the donut method.
